Termination Path 1
Binance Tweaks the Index 

>Trigger
Binance spots an oracle bug and drops/reduces the messed up OKX spot price from its index.

>How It Works
~60% of the index came from Binance futures, creating a self-feeding feedback loop. Remove the bad data ‚Üí index & mark price crash.

>Immediate Effect: Binance futures tanks. Mark price dives to true on chain value. Long positions get liquidated.

>Asymmetric Outcome: Game ends on Binance, but OKX‚Äôs isolated liquidity island stays.

tweets.author: Tintinx2021

tweets.content:
/FINAL PART: The Two Ways the $SLERF Game Could End¬†

Let's review what happened before.

>The Setup
Spotting the Opportunity
Traders noticed $SLERF on OKX had very low liquidity and deposits/withdrawals were paused.

>Phase 1
Traders bought and sold $SLERF on OKX, pushing its spot price up.

>Phase 2
The higher price on OKX affected Binance futures‚Äô mark price because of how the index is calculated. And This mark price rise then fed back into the index due to a self-reference.
This caused short positions to liquidate, creating a feedback loop.

>Phase 3
Traders who had positions on Binance futures made profits as the price effect spread.

So‚Ä¶ $SLERF relied on two fragile points. 

Break either one, and the game‚Äôs over, just differently.
